abstract: “Who would want to buy a stock that’s still 80 percent owned by the government?” wondered William T. Fitzpatrick, an equity analyst at Optique Capital.
snippet: “Who would want to buy a stock that’s still 80 percent owned by the government?” wondered William T. Fitzpatrick, an equity analyst at Optique Capital.
lead_paragraph: It may have been written off as a hopeless case less than a year ago, but the stock of the American International Group shot up to $50 on Thursday, capping a fourfold gain in the last two months.

headline.main: A.I.G. Rises, and Many Ask Why
headline.print_headline: A.I.G. Rises, And Many Ask Why
